page.description: Gets the current record's logical position in the current sort order
page.discussion: The <TBL>.LOGICALRECORD_GET() method returns the current record's logical position in the current sort order.
page.example: dim tbl as P dim inx as P tbl = table.open("customer") tbl.fetch_first() ui_msg_box("First record", "The first record is " + tbl.LogicalRecord_Get()+ " for " + tbl.Lastname) tbl.fetch_next() ui_msg_box("Next record", "The next record is " + tbl.LogicalRecord_Get()+ " for " + tbl.Lastname) query.order = "customer->Lastname" inx = tbl.query_create() tbl.fetch_first() ui_msg_box("First record", "The first record is " + tbl.LogicalRecord_Get()+ " for " + tbl.Lastname) tbl.fetch_next() ui_msg_box("Next record", "The next record is " + tbl.LogicalRecord_Get()+ " for " + tbl.Lastname) tbl.close()
